metadata.name: A Fistful of Dollars #1
metadata.description:
The minaret of a mosque that was destroyed by ISIS on the grounds that it was a Shiite mosque.

A little background of the conflict: 

16 June 2014 - ISIS captured Tal Afar after a two-day battle.

Tens of thousands of people were displaced. Thousands of people were left to die en masse. Hundreds of women and children were subjected to torture and rape. Little girls who were left hungry and thirsty and tortured for days were forcibly married to older ISIS militants.

On 20 August 2017,  the Iraqi Army backed by US Army announced it had launched a new offensive. 

The Iraqi army, which started the ground operation after intense air attacks, captured the city 7 days later, on 27 August.

An entire city and thousands of lives were destroyed for A Fistful of Dollars.

-
Collector will get the full copyright of the artwork.

Photographer: Osman GÃ¼lveren
Type: 1/1 Documentary Photography
Location: Tal Afar, Iraq
Time: 19 November 2018
